list_definition.mean_english: hộ lý, nhân viên cấp cứu
list_definition.definition: someone who is trained to help people who are ill or injured, especially in emergency situations, but who is not a doctor or a nurse

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: Paramedics treated the injured woman at the scene of the accident.

list_ex_of_english: Although the trust fell into significant arrears with its paramedic re-certification programme in 1996, the panel found that the situation has improved.
Some are led by junior doctors, some by nurses and others by paramedics.
There will be no change in top-sliced funding in 1997–98 in respect of ambulance paramedics training.
In two cases, the panelists disagreed whether ambulance paramedic personnel would have managed complications that probably would have happened during the alternative transport.
I also understand that further training has been secured for paramedics, and that two additional instructor posts are being advertised to meet future training requirements.
Had there been controls on stewarding, paramedics and supervision inside the dance hall at an earlier stage, the closure might have been prevented.
After a further two years, all prospective paramedics must pass a stringent examination before being accepted for training.
The intervention vehicle used to convey the nurse and paramedic was a fully equipped emergency response car.
